abstract: Fred Melamed has left Ethan Coen's one-act play.
snippet: Fred Melamed has left Ethan Coen's one-act play.
lead_paragraph: The last collaboration between the actor Fred Melamed and the filmmaker Ethan Coen yielded one of the silkiest screen villains in recent years: Sy Ableman, the gently bearish widower in "A Serious Man" (2009), who seduces the wife of the main character and then keeps explaining the logic of the cuckolding to him. (Sy: "Such a thing, such a thing - you know, Larry, the way we handle ourselves in this situation is so important.") But their latest outing together, in the Broadway production "Relatively Speaking," has not gone as smoothly: He left the show after the matinee on Sunday.
